sub_title: Champion, Compassionate, VACC Leadership, Diversity (DEI) Champion- Intercultural, Intergenerational, Non-binary, LGBTQI+, Age Diversity; Leader, Operations & Change Management in Hybrid Workplace, Values Driven Champion
summary:
Inspired by an unwavering belief and experience in the untapped talent and potential in all humans, organizations, and communities to realize excellence that benefits humanity, I lead and manage by inspiring, engaging, coaching, analyzing, and leveraging human capital, achieving healthy workplaces and work cultures, effective networks and partnerships, that create opportunities and value, contributing to global human progress and sustainability for current and future generations. I believe that I am defined by IQ, EQ, values and ethics, lifelong growth and great character - grit, determination, optimism,  resilience, resourcefulness, balanced with humility, appreciation and gratitude.

•	A Compassionate People Leader with strong values, ethics & integrity with a passion for employee and team function and creating a healthy, exceptional workplace
•	A DEI Champion/Leader/Manager with decades of experience and skills in intercultural, intergenerational, interdisciplinary leadership and related skills and competence applied in developed and developing country workplaces with excellent results and employee engagement
•	An accomplished Operations Manager able to think strategically & execute - reduced caseload 800% in 6 months
•	An Executive with passion for partnership, people, and innovation
•	A Medical Expert in HIV and palliative medicine, and global public health
•	A Strong Partnership Builder bringing together diverse sectors, cultures, and generations for a shared way forward and winning outcomes
•	An Experience Project/Program Manager - managed millions annually
•	A Strong Global Operations Manager and Communications Executive

I am an executive who connects with people & teams to:  1) create a respectful, healthy workplace with DEI and workplace health practices and skills, 2.  solve complex organizational problems in the New Normal post-Covid hybrid workplace, create value, and achieve excellence, using a combination of strategic, analytic & interpersonal skills. My commitment is to achieve 50% more value in one year.

treasury_media.title: 'Millions denied end-of-life drugs'
treasury_media.description: Lack of access to pain relief for dying patients is a "public health emergency", say experts. Figures suggest almost 18 million people - mainly in developing countries - died in unnecessary pain in 2012. In Ethiopia, there are reports of cancer patients throwing themselves in front of trucks to escape pain.

awards.title: Honoree, Canadian Working Group on HIV and Rehabilitation
awards.description:
The Canadian Working Group on HIV and Rehabilitation (CWGHR) is a leader and catalyst for improved rehabilitation for people living with HIV and related conditions through integrated research, education, policy and practice.  At their 15th Anniversary Celebration held on June 12, 2014 in Toronto Canada, 15 Honorees for the 15th Anniversary were identified for their commitment to CWGHR and to improving the lives of people living with HIV.  

When asked to describe what CWGHR means to you, on a personal level?  I responded, "CWGHR and HIV rehabilitation are part of my memory of when the HIV epidemic lightened and there was hope!"

The full list of honorees and their recollections can be found at:  http://www.hivandrehab.ca/EN/Whats_New/documents/BookletforreceptiontomarktheendofCWGHR15thAnniversaryEN.pdf

awards.description:

This e-Medical system was launched in January 2013 and will be rolled-out to 106 countries across the globe.

Achieving stronger understanding and competencies in the field of Compassionate Leadership and other emerging management and leadership theory.  Increasing language competencies in French, Spanish, Italian, and German.  Developing tools for end-of-life and palliative care, including a novel.

I will continue to champion compassionate management to engage teams, foster professional development, enrich the professional lives of employees and fellow leaders, and create human capital.  

Future areas of work will include team leadership, palliative and HIV care, workplace health, operations and HR management. 

I have an interest in leading teams in a variety of settings and professional areas, including health/biomedical start up, global public health, veterans health, elder care, end of life programs, LGBTQ+ and minority issues, cross cultural and inter-generational leadership, and innovations in cancer and chronic care. 

Politics may be an avenue to lead social, community, and health care innovation and change to increase opportunity and improve the quality of life for all Canadians including those who live in marginalized or hard-to-reach communities. 

I seek to contribute to the positive evolution of Society and the Planet.

profile_positions.description:
Program Responsibility for - for Immigration Medical Screening and Management of Medical Examiners for China, South East Asia, Taiwan, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Brunei, Australia, New Zealand, Fiji, New Caledonia

At Mid Year - What the Manager said about the Regional Medical Office (RMO) in Manila - The objectives set for the 2015-16 appraisal period are all "on track" if not already attained. For instance, case works is done in an timely manner and when inventories are building up due to technical problems or resources need for instance, the ROM is now able to detect the trend or issue right away and look at remedial options. This is in good part because of the responsabilisation of all staff to the RMO, a result of many sessions to explain the overall objectives of the team and individual contributions and responsibilities. This is clearly coming from the hands-on leadership of Dr. Bally...During this important transition period, the managing strength of Dr. Bally has been invaluable. He has created a strong team with the confidence to keep up the good work and start new programme integrity initiatives.  Aug. 6, 2015
	
This Regional Medical Office experienced exponential growth from a 75K caseload in 2013, to 175K (125% increase), and an estimated caseload of 210K in 2015.  As well, the Office manages 93 Panel Physician Sites, and monitors over 270 cases of active TB annually.

Achievements - 
- Improved overall efficiency by 33% in one month and 41% in the first three months
- Of three operational backlogs in Oct 2014, led team innovation and operations management to eliminate two backlogs in the first three months, and the third  by the fifth month
- Developed and implemented a sustainability business case to strengthen team 
- Developed a regional network of accredited chest physicians to strengthen TB management for the over 270 active TB cases annually
